segments.text: Somebody broke into my house in the morning .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: About 12 o'clock , when I came home from work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Apparently forced entry . The lock is battered to pieces .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I wonder how the burglar did it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: He is so unskillful . I have never seen such an awkward burglar .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's because we have a strong lock .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Probably . Let's check the inside then .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , the house was in a terrible mess . It was almost turned upside down by the burglar .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , er ... sorry that's because we didn't have time to clean it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You mean it is not created by the burglar ?
segments.speaker: S1
